guideline.name: Annotation of DPWG Guideline for voriconazole and CYP2C19

relatedGenes.name: cytochrome P450 family 2 subfamily C member 19

recommendations.name: Recommendation PA166299274

text.html: Use an initial dose that is 1.5x higher and monitor the plasma concentration.

implications: The gene variation increases the conversion of voriconazole, which increases the risk of ineffectiveness.

recommendations.name: Recommendation PA166299273

text.html: The guideline does not provide a recommendation for voriconazole in normal metabolizers.

implications: The guideline does not provide a description of the impact of a normal metabolizer phenotype on voriconazole.

recommendations.name: Recommendation PA166299276

text.html: Use 50% of the standard dose and monitor the plasma concentration.

implications: The gene variation can reduce the conversion of voriconazole and consequently increase the plasma concentration. This could result in improved efficacy or an increase in the risk of side effects. Initially, the risk of side effects is of particular interest.
